title: Reed Exhibitions Greater China’s Undergraduate Program Shines New LightTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Reed Exhibitions Greater China’s Undergraduate Program Shines New Light Published on : Monday, August 17, 2015
In pursuit of discovering potential student talents, the Reed Exhibitions Undergraduate Program will provide successful candidates with a one–year,full-time internship within business teams across RXGC starting from July 2015. The internship program is tailored to the students’ own interests and talents with a focus on creativity, teamwork and communication skills. Twenty six young talents and 2016 graduates been recruited and is expected to be on-board over the next few months.
Throughout the year, interns will accumulate professional experience and receive professional advice and ‘career coaching’ with a firsthand view of the ins and outs of event management, while benefiting from on-going incentive plans and a systematic training program with objective performance assessments designed to help them recognize their own potential. Upon completion of the internship, the most outstanding students will have an opportunity to work full-time at Reed.
Reed’s well-respected tradition of educational programs places a premium on recruiting,developing and retaining China’s best and brightest with customized, experiential learning that provides an across-the-board understanding of the exhibition industry.
Reed’s additional student program includes the Reed Scholarship Program which focuses on young talents from China’s major universities. The one-year Reed Exhibitions Undergraduate Program forms part of Reed’s award-winning learning and development programs designed to help its employees at all stages of their career path.
Source:-Reed Exhibitions
